SENT.plain: Autobiographical memories in our lives are critically dependent on temporal lobe structures
However, the contribution of CA1 neurons in the human hippocampus to the retrieval of episodic autobiographical memory remains elusive
In patients with a rare acute transient global amnesia, highly focal lesions confined to the CA1 field of the hippocampus can be detected on MRI
We studied the effect of these lesions on autobiographical memory using a detailed autobiographical interview including the remember/know procedure
In 14 of 16 patients, focal lesions in the CA1 sector of the hippocampal cornu ammonis were detected
Autobiographical memory was significantly affected over all time periods, including memory for remote periods
Impairment of episodic memory and autonoetic consciousness exhibited a strong temporal gradient extending 30 to 40 y into the past
These results highlight the distinct and critical role of human hippocampal CA1 neurons in autobiographical memory retrieval and for re-experiencing detailed episodic memories
